result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

8:05 AM Defendant Amanda M Cayo not in court.  Attorney Courtney Christine Jolin in court for Amanda M Cayo.  Attorney Karl Peter Hayes in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant called COC Office and stated she will be 15 minutes late.  Court to allow defendant until 8:15 am to appear.  Off record at 8:10 am. On record at 8:15 am.  Cases recalled.  Court recesses for 4 more minutes.  Defendant now appears at 8:19 am.  Waiver of preliminary hearing.  Rights given.  Court finds that waiver is done so knowingly and voluntarily.  Probable cause found.  Bound over for arraignment on an information.  Information to be e-filed.  Waive reading.  Not guilty pleas entered.  Bond continued.
